turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Well.    I don't like men with...er, with too many, muscles.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I didn't make him for you

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: You beast, you monster, what have you done with Brad?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Nothing.  Why, do you think I should?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: You tricked me - I wouldn't have - I've never - never

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I know.  But it wasn't all bad was it? In fact, I think you found it quite pleasurable. Mmmmm so soft, so sensual.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Ssssh.  Brad's probably asleep by now. Do you want him to see you like this?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Like this - like how?  It's your fault. You're to blame.  I was saving myself.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Well, I'm sure you're not spent yet.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Promise you won't tell Brad.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Cross my heart and hope to die.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What a guy

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Makes you cry

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What guy

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Makes you cry

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: "Sweet Transvestite"

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: From Transexual Transylvania.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: "Transylvania"

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: So come up to the Lab.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: On the day I went away.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Goodbye

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Was all I had to say

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Now I

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Want to come again and stay

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Oh my, my,

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Smile and that will mean I may

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Feeling

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Like I'm outside in the rain

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Wheeling

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Free to try and find a game

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Dealing

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Cards for sorrow, Cards for pain.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: And left from my dreaming Was a feeling Of un-nameable dread.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: That ain't no crime

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: My high is low. I'm dressed up With no place to go.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Oh, no no, no no.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No no no, no no.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime - That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Oh no no no no.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No no no no.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime. That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No no no no.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No no no no.

turns.speaker: GUESTS
turns.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime - That ain't no crime.

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: I think you had better both come inside.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: You're too kind.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Are you - giving a party?

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: No.  You've arrived on a rather special night.  It's one of the master's affairs.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Oh, lucky him.

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: The Master is not yet married.  Nor do I think he ever will be.  We are simply his servants.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Who's Eddie?

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: The delivery boy.

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: Creature of the night.

turns.speaker: MAGENTA
turns.text: Creature of the night.

turns.speaker: MAGENTA
turns.text: I thought you liked them.  They liked you.

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: They didn't like me.  They never liked me.

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: Our noble mission is almost completed my most beautiful sister, soon we will return to the moon-drenched shores of our "androgenous" planet.

turns.speaker: MAGENTA
turns.text: Ah - sweet Transexual - land of night - to sing and dance once more to your dark refrains.  To take that step to the right...

turns.speaker: RIFF RAFF
turns.text: But it's the pelvic thrust that really drives you insane.

turns.speaker: MAGENTA
turns.text: And our World will do the Time Warp again.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...How's the turtle food this week?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Fine.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Me, I'm kinda aggravated.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ain't your fault -- Here's the problem.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I smack 'em hard on the shell an' they get... What?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...I don't know.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Shell-shocked!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey, how's my buddy doin'?  -- Nice dog -- Well, I'll see ya later.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Goodnight, Rocky.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It's Thanksgiving.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: To you, to me it's Thursday.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Looks quiet, y'know.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I think it's closed.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I think mebbe we're early or somethin' --

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Aren't you skating?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ain't skated since I was fifteen -- That's when I started fightin' -- gotta watch the ankles. Yeah, fightin' use to be tops with me, but no more. All I wanted to prove was I weren't no bum -- That I had the stuff to make a good pro.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: And you never got the chance?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: But you never had a chance to prove yourself.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I just dislocated my finger.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Ohh!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Y'know how I got started in the fight racket?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: By accident?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What's funny?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: My mother told me just the opposite. She said, 'You weren't born with much of a body so you'd better develop your brain.'

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Some people are very shy by nature.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...I suppose.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I would say you're very shy by nature.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...I suppose.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Some people think bein' shy is a disease, but it don't bother me.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It doesn't bother me either.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Then why did I bother bringin' it up? 'Cause I'm dumb, that's why... Y'know, I think we make a real sharp coupla coconuts -- I'm dumb an' you're shy.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...It is just hard for me to understand why anybody wants to be a fighter.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya gotta be a little soft to wanna be a pug... It's a racket where ya' almost guaranteed to end up a bum.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I don't think you're a bum.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...I'm at least half a bum. Yeah, fightin' is a crazy racket. The roughest part is the mornin' after.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Morning after?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: After a rough fight, ya' nothin' but a large wound. Sometimes I feel like callin' a taxi to drive me from my bed to the bathroom... Ya' eyes hurt, ya' ears hurt, ya' hair even hurts... But the thing I'm proud of is I been in over sixty fights an' never had a busted nose -- Bent an' twisted an' bitten but never broke... That's rare.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Why do you do it if it hurts so bad?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Guess.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: 'Cause you can't sing or dance?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Would ya like a glass of water?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...No thanks.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Here's the guys I was tellin' ya about -- This is Cuff an' Link.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I sold them to you.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Oh, yeah, I bought the whole kit -- Yeah, ya sold me the turtles, the bowl, an' the mountain -- I had to get rid of the mountain 'cause they kept fallin' off.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Do you have a phone?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I had it pulled. People callin' all the time.  Who needs it -- Who'd you wanna call?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I wanna let my brother know where I am.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: D'you really wanna call?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Yes, I do.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I think he might be worried.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I'll call your brother.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What's the matter? Ya don't like the room?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It's fine.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It's only temporary.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It's not that --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What's the problem? You don't like me -- Don't like the turtles -- What is it?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I don't think I belong here.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: No, I don't belong here.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It's all right -- You're my guest.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...I've never been in a man's apartment before.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: They're all the same.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I'm not sure I know you well enough -- I don't think I'm comfortable.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo, I'm not comfortable either.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I should leave.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: But I'm willin' to make the best of this uncomfortable situation.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Would ya take off your glasses?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: The glasses... Please.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...T-thank you.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Do me another favor?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Could ya take off that hat.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I always knew you was pretty.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't tease me.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How'd ya like hearin' ya name on TV?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I don't know -- I was shocked. Why did you do that?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya puttin' me on, right?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Absolutely -- What time should I expect you?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: 'Bout seven.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I'll be waiting.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Y'know how I said that stuff on television didn't bother me?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It did.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't you open them anymore?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: They either say, 'Kill the nigger' or 'Hope you die, Honky.' -- What ya got in the bag?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Like?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Sharp -- Real nice.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Really -- You don't think they're overly feminine?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No... Sharp -- You look great.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Adrian, you really look great, y'know -- But I can't fool around durin' trainin' -- makes the legs weak.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't want weak legs.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Can't fool around -- You look very great.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: -- The legs.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah... But I think weak legs ain't bad sometimes, y'know.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I thought it might be cute.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Ya right --  Mebbe we best just hold hands -- the shirt made me feel guilty, y'know.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...And he called the reporters --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah... Threw my whole day off.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't be mad at him -- He just wants to help.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yo -- I ain't mad. I'm just outta joint when reporters are around -- They take cheap shots an' Paulie knows it.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Are you going to say anything to him?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...What's to say? I dunno what he wants from me --

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Wanna hear a dirty joke?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Rocky, do you realize everybody in this country knows your face, and after the fight everybody in the world is going to.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: What was that you said about a pet shop?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: What did you say about a pet shop?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I don't want ya cleanin' nobody else's cages no more.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Is everything all right?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I gotta go out for a while.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Can't do it.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...I can't beat him.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Apollo?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah, I can't beat him.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I been watchin' the movies -- studyin' -- He ain't weak nowhere.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: What're we going to do?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...I dunno.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Oh, Rocky -- you worked so hard.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It ain't so bad, 'cause I was a nothin' before --

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't say that.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: C'mon, it's true -- But that don't bother me -- I just wanna prove somethin' -- I ain't no bum... It don't matter if I lose... Don't matter if he opens my head... The only thing I wanna do is go the distance -- That's all. Nobody's ever gone fifteen rounds with Creed. If I go them fifteen rounds, an' that bell rings an' I'm still standin', I'm gonna know then I weren't just another bum from the neighborhood...

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Paulie, why didn't you tell me you were bringing him home?! Look at me, I'm not ready for this.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Like it would make a difference if you were, right? This guy's a friend and now he's takin' ya out.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: No... I can't!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Ya, ya goin' outta the bedroom an' I don't wanna know from nothin'.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Paulie, please --

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Hey, I want ya out instamaticly. -- I'm sicka lookin' at ya hangin' around like a friggin' spider -- Go out -- Live! Do, enjoy life.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Like you?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Don't get wise with me. I want ya to stop bein' a loser.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I can't go out.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Paulie, it's Thanksgiving. I've gotta turkey in the oven.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Do me a favor -- His lungs, punch 'em out.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Paul.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Oh, Rocky!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Christ.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: You didn't!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Einstein flunked out of school... twice.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: That so.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Roosevelt finished last in his class -- Beethoven was deaf, an' Helen Keller was blind -- I think Rocky has a good chance.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Nothin'! I want nothin' from you!!!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Paulie!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Shutup! I want nothin' -- I ain't no charity case! Get outta my house!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It's not your house --

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: You ain't no friend no more -- Go home! Outta my house I want ya!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't talk like that to him!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Get outta my life both of ya's.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: ...Paulie. Stop now!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I want 'im outta here --  Don't think I'm good enough to work for Gazzo?  That's what I think of bums like you an' Gazzo!  You're goin' up an' don't care enough to throw Paulie some crumbs!  I give ya meat, an' I give ya my sister, too!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Only a pig would say that!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: You forget what I went through to give ya the best.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: You gave me what?! Knots! You gave me knots in here every day -- you made me scared of everything!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: I always seen ya had the best, but did ya ever think of puttin' in a good word for me with this scumbag!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Don't do that again!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: Get away from me -- I could never even get married 'cause you couldn't live by yaself -- ya'd die by yaself! So instead I put you two together -- Did ya think of puttin' in a good word for me? -- You owe me!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Owe you what?

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: You owe me an' are supposed to treat me good!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Good? Good, Paulie?! I've been treatin' you like a baby. Since I can't remember it's so long -- I'm the only one who feeds you an' puts you in bed when ya can't stand up -- and it's you that made me feel like a loser -- That's what ya use to call me 'Loser' -- What kind of name is that? So can ya blame me for not remembering to talk about you when I'm with Rocky -- I don't owe you, Paulie, you owe me.

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: You busted?!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: PAULIE
turns.text: You a virgin? -- Ya let 'im in ya pants, didn't ya!  Ya pulled down ya pants an' let him have it, didn't ya!!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: I do -- Maybe what this fight needs is something new -- a novelty.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: You's the novelty, Champ!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Give my main man a raise!!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Too old, dull fighter.  Bobby Judge is a good boy.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...I don't feel heat from the name.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: He won't last one round.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Listen, I gonna carry this boy three rounds, then drop 'im like a bad habit.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: I don't like you messin' with southpaws -- They do everything wrong.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Southpaw, nuthin' -- I'll drop 'im in three -- 'Apollo Creed meets the Italian Stallion.' Shhiii -- Sounds like a damn monster movie!!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...That boy damn near broke my arm.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Sure -- He can hit -- Don't play no more -- Stick an' move, hear?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: I'll carry him 'till the third.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Don't play with this man, he's fightin' hard -- Let 'em feel some real heat!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Man, I rearranged his face with that right -- The people love what's happenin' tonight.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: People nothin', you in a fight, my man, -- ya best believe what you hear... Knock that boy out soon an' let's go home.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...That man's takin' his job too serious.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: He's movin' to your left -- don't let him no more -- dance and stick, hear? Don't play -- I know what ya feelin', but don't play.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: He got lucky.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Luck! You fightin' a crazy man -- but you got him hurt bad.  More ice, now!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: My side.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Get that doctor.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: No doctor!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: You're hurtin', man!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: No doctor!... I'm feelin' good, bro!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Yo' bleedin' inside, man -- Get that doctor.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: One more round.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Don't kill yourself, man -- Let the doctor stop the fight.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...Stop jivin'!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Cover the ribs -- Look here, elbow down, tight -- Tight -- stand straight -- you're the best, you're the best!

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...Thanks.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: I suppose we could cancel the fight indefinitely if you are set on fighting Green.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: You best find me another ranked contender an' I mean in a flash, man!

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: I contacted Ernie Roman's manager, he's fighting in France the same week.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Then gimme Buddy Shaw -- He's ranked fifth.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Shaw's fighting in South America -- Why not postpone the bout until July Fourth?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Shape, nothin' -- They're afraid. They know everybody in the world's gonna see this fight an' none of them gotta prayer of beating me so they're makin' excuses so they don't have to be the chump that's gonna be whipped in front of the whole civilized world!!

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Apollo, I'm sure there's a way to salvage this.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Now here's what's goin' down. Listen, 'cause I'm gonna say this but one time. On January first, the first day of the Bicentennial I'm gonna fight me a local poor underdog, dig? A snow-white underdog. An' I'm gonna put his face on this poster with me, hear? An' I'll tell you why, 'cause I'm sentimental -- An' all the people in the country all sentimental, man, an' they'd like nothin' better than me, Apollo Creed, to let some unknown get a shot at the greatest title in the world on this country's biggest birthday. Now that's the way I see it an' that's the way I want it!!

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: ...It's very American.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: No, man, it's very smart.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: How 'bout this Billy Snow?

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Fouls.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: How 'bout this Big Chuck Smith?

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Joe Zack is a good prospect -- Exciting boy.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...Still don't feel no heat.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Exactly what are you looking for, Apollo?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...This man.

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: 'The Italian Stallion' -- He's my man.

turns.speaker: JERGENS
turns.text: Rocky Balboa -- His record's poor --

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Don't matter -- That name. 'The Italian Stallion,' it's right on.  Who discovered America? An Italian, right? So, man, what could be better than to get it on with one of his ancestors --

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR
turns.text: How was the flight, Champ?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Very high an' very fast.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR
turns.text: Apollo, how would you rate this last British challenger, Henry Wilcoxson?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: He was big, an' very nasty so I destroyed him in a hurry -- Now I'm gettin' ready for Mac Lee Green next month.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR
turns.text: You're referring to the much publicized bicentennial fight?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: That's right -- It's gonna be the greatest sportin' event in this country's history -- A gala occurrence!

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR
turns.text: Still to be held in Philadelphia?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: The Bicentennial Heavyweight Championship of the World is gonna be held in the only place it can be held -- Philadelphia! -- the nation's cradle -- January First -- the first major event of our two hundredth year.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR
turns.text: Where're you off to now?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: Me an' my wife are goin' home 'cause we miss our children an' can't go no more time without seein' them.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR
turns.text: Any quick advice for young boxing hopefuls?

turns.speaker: APOLLO
turns.text: ...Stay in school an' use your brains, dig -- Be a lawyer, be a doctor, carry a leather briefcase an' forget about sports!! Sports can only make ya grunt an' smell -- Be a thinker not a stinker!!

turns.speaker: BODYGUARD
turns.text: Did ya get the license number?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Of wa?

turns.speaker: BODYGUARD
turns.text: ...Of the truck that run over your face.

turns.speaker: BODYGUARD
turns.text: Hear she's retarded.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: She ain't retarded, she's shy.

turns.speaker: BODYGUARD
turns.text: Take 'er to the zoo -- Retards like the zoo.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Does that bum have to say that?

turns.speaker: BODYGUARD
turns.text: I don't like ya face.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Don't like yours neither.

turns.speaker: BODYGUARD
turns.text: Kiss my ass.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Move your shoulders down.

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: Yo, Rocks, buy us sum wine, man.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...No wine -- Bad for ya' brain.

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: C'mon, man, it's cold, man.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No wine.

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: Yo, Rock, gimme a dollar.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: 'Cause we dig ya, man -- Gimme a dollar.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: No dollar.

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: Hey, give Rocky a dime.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...That's an old one.

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: Buy us some Thunderbird, man.

turns.speaker: CHIPPED TOOTH
turns.text: We'll kill you, man -- We gotta gun.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Pull heat on me? -- I'll dent ya face!

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Hey, whatta ya doin' here -- we're closed... Yo, we're closed!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Are ya closed to the General Public or to just everybody.

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Hey, the rink is empty 'cause we're closed -- ya ain't allowed in here so do me a favor an' not stay here.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Wait here, gotta smooth this guy out.

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Yo, pal, what's with you -- The place ain't operatin'.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Listen, I gotta problem. This girl ain't feelin' well, y'know -- The doctor says she should exercise, y'know once in awhile an' ice skatin' is the best thing --

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: This a con?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Look at her, ya can see she ain't feelin' good -- needs a few minutes exercise --

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Few minutes?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Ten minutes.

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Ten minutes for ten dollars.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: ...Yeah, give 'er the Blades.

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Nine minutes!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Hey, I ain't cryin'... I still fight. Kinda do it like a hobby. See I'm a natural southpaw an' most pugs won't fight a southpaw 'cause we mess up their timin' an' look awkward -- Southpaw means lefthanded... But I guess in the long run things probably worked out for the best, right?

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Seven minutes!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: It ain't your fault -- I originally done it in the Baby Crenshaw fight.  That's me fightin' Big Baby Crenshaw -- Big Baby was the size of an airplane an' I broke my hands on his head -- I lost, but it's a nice picture, don't ya think?

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Six!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: How 'bout some Cokes?

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Cost ya a buck.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: This guy is beautiful -- get the Cokes.

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: Here -- Three minutes.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Yeah -- My ol' man who was never the sharpest told me -- I weren't born with much brain so I better use my body.

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: That's ten bucks.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I must be goin' deaf 'cause I thought ya said, 'ten cents.'

turns.speaker: CLEANER
turns.text: ...How 'bout for the Cokes?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Charge it.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: We would like to welcome our viewing audience to the Grand World Championship Bicentennial Heavyweight Fight -- the first major event of the Bicentennial Year... A point of interest is that the fight is being beamed to more than seven hundred and fifty million fans in theatres in nearly every corner of the world. I would like to welcome an old friend, and co-commentator for this evening's event -- Jimmy Michaels.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: Thank you, Bob. The electricity is everywhere tonight. Rocky Balboa, a fifty-to-one underdog, is living a Cinderella story which has captured peoples' imaginations all over the world -- to quote a popular sports magazine, 'The fighting style should be 'The Caveman Against the Cavalier.' From the increase in sound it appears the challenger is now approaching the ring... His record is forty-four wins, twenty losses and thirty-eight knockouts.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: I only wonder if this man has the skill to go past three rounds -- Vegas odds say, 'no.'

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: You could go deaf with the noise -- it undoubtedly means Champion Apollo Creed is heading towards the ring --

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: Am I seeing right? Creed is approaching the ring in a boat. Is he supposed to be George Washington? Obviously so.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: It's been confirmed that it is definitely an impersonation of George Washington -- a great way to start 1976 off.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: I agree.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: The Champ stings the slower challenger with jabs at will -- Balboa blocks eighty percent of the blows with his face -- Creed doesn't look the best he's ever been but is moving smoothly -- Creed snaps out a triple combination that backs Balboa into a corner -- oh, a solid hook by Creed, a master of fist-men.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: The Champion is smiling and toying with the man -- trying to give the fans their money's worth and make a show of it with the badly out-classes challenger -- Another left to right combination. I feel sorry for --

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: Creed is down!!!

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: If you had asked anyone who knows boxing, they never would've predicted a first round knockdown and the second round punishment to the body of the Champion... Most fighters will tell you, receiving a good body punch is the next worst thing to dying.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: Round three ready to start and should be interesting to see if Creed can put the challenger away -- there goes the bell.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: Apollo almost sprints out of his corner -- feints and throws a pair of left-right combinations. Balboa drops beneath a left upper cut and lands a very solid shot on Creed's temple -- not much movement from Balboa, duck a left, a right, another left and explodes with a right hook to the temple -- I mean explodes. The Champ backs off.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: There's no way Apollo expected this kind of hitting power.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: No way -- but the brilliant ability of the Champion to master situations like this is one of his most outstanding traits -- Creed tosses a perfect right hand that rocks Rocky. Creed on the offensive -- Balboa takes the punishment and counters with a left flush over the heart... that hurt.

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #1
turns.text: Without a doubt this is the most punishing brawl I have ever seen -- The ringside audience is spotted with blood. This fight should have been stopped rounds ago but Rocky Balboa refuses to fall --

turns.speaker: COMMENTATOR #2
turns.text: Not only has he refused to fall, but he has beaten the Champion's body without mercy and the bout has become a vicious slugfest.

turns.speaker: DIPPER
turns.text: I say ya nothin'!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What's happenin' here?

turns.speaker: DIPPER
turns.text: I'm happenin'! This pig is takin' my shot -- I iz a contender. He's nothin'.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You can forget about sparring, kid.

turns.speaker: DIPPER
turns.text: Yo' know I iz the best man here! Yo' said so yoself!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Why let Rocky here take a chance on cuttin' or breakin' a hand? -- Take a shower, Dipper.

turns.speaker: DIPPER
turns.text: Don't mouth me, old man, I'll knock yo' out too. C'mon, wop, spar me, let everybody see who's got the heat around here.

turns.speaker: DIPPER
turns.text: Yo' yellow, old man.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Not yellow, cautious.  See, it's very easy for a fighter to accidentally hurt --

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: Don't hit the face! Not the face!!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Mr. Gazzo wants the two hundred now!

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: Honest to God I'm broke -- Gimme a break.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Mr. Gazzo says I should get two hundred or break the thumb.

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: Please, I need my hands to work -- Christ, don't bust my thumbs.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What's ya name again?

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: Bob.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Look, Bob, if ya wanna dance, ya gotta pay the band -- If ya borrow, ya gotta pay the man... Me, I ain't emotionally involved.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: A hundred an' thirty.

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: That's it, I'm broke.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: That's it? -- Completely?

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What about for food an' stuff?

turns.speaker: FATS
turns.text: You have my food in ya hand.
